content:
Diagnosis:		Grade 3 invasive micropapillary carcinoma of left breast with mixed features

Stage:		pT2N1M0 (Stage IIB)

Biomarkers:	ER 8/8, PR 6/8, HER2 3+, Ki67 45%, BRCA1/2 negative

Trial Status:	Cycle 4 KATHERINE trial (T-DM1 vs Trastuzumab)

[redacted name] attended for trial assessment today. She completed neoadjuvant chemotherapy with 6 cycles of docetaxel/carboplatin/trastuzumab/pertuzumab in January 2024, achieving partial response. She underwent left wide local excision with axillary clearance on 15 February 2024, showing residual invasive disease of 2.8cm with 2/12 positive nodes, making her eligible for the KATHERINE trial. She was randomized on 15 March 2024 and today completes cycle 4 of trial medication.

She is tolerating the trial medication well with only grade 1 fatigue and occasional headaches. Her main side effect is mild peripheral neuropathy affecting her fingertips, which she rates as 2/10 severity and is not impacting daily activities. Blood tests show stable parameters with hemoglobin 118 g/L, platelets 245, normal liver function. Cardiac monitoring shows preserved ejection fraction at 58% on latest echo (12 April 2024).

On examination today, her left breast surgical site is well-healed with no concerning features. There is no lymphedema. Performance status remains 0.

I have completed the trial-specific quality of life questionnaires and toxicity assessments. She will continue with cycle 5 today as per protocol. Next trial assessment is scheduled in 3 weeks with repeat cardiac imaging as per protocol timeline.

primary_cancer.histopathology_status: Grade 3 invasive micropapillary carcinoma with mixed features
primary_cancer.biomarker_status: ER 8/8, PR 6/8, HER2 3+, Ki67 45%, BRCA1/2 negative

cancer_timeline.value: Completed 6 cycles of neoadjuvant therapy with partial response
Left wide local excision with axillary clearance showing residual 2.8cm invasive disease, 2/12 positive nodes
Randomized to KATHERINE trial (T-DM1 vs Trastuzumab)
Cardiac echo shows preserved ejection fraction at 58%

patient_facts.value: Mild peripheral neuropathy affecting fingertips, rated 2/10 severity
Well-healed left breast surgical site, no lymphedema
Hemoglobin 118 g/L, platelets 245, normal liver function

status_updates.value: Stage IIB breast cancer post neoadjuvant therapy and surgery, now on KATHERINE trial. Tolerating treatment well with minimal side effects
Grade 1 fatigue, occasional headaches, and mild peripheral neuropathy
Continuing with cycle 5 of trial medication as per protocol
Next trial assessment in 3 weeks with cardiac imaging
